options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: The education system is irrelevant to the real world

title: How to master your sense of smell - Alexandra Horowitz

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: They smell with their eyes closed.

options.label: B
options.text: Near the bridge of the nose in the olfactory epithelium.

options.text: They start to smell new odors.

options.label: B

options.label: D
options.text: It loses the ability to smell.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.text: To have the students participate in a debate.

options.label: B
options.text: He was indifferent to the experience.

multiple-choice.question: Who inspired the speaker to become an entrepreneur?

options.label: A
options.text: To build the biggest company in the world.

multiple-choice.question: What held the speaker back from achieving his goals?
What was the turning point for the speaker in overcoming his fear of rejection?

options.label: A
options.text: When he started his own company.

options.label: C
options.text: When he discovered the website rejectiontherapy.com.

options.label: D
options.text: When he had a successful business idea.

multiple-choice.question: What was the speaker's 100-day rejection challenge?

options.label: D
options.text: To do something that might get him rejected every day for 100 days.

multiple-choice.question: What did the speaker learn from his rejection challenge?

options.label: A
options.text: That rejection is always a negative experience.

options.label: B
options.text: That people are always mean when they reject you.

options.label: C
options.text: That asking "why" can turn a "no" into a "yes".

options.label: D
options.text: That rejection is never an opportunity.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the speaker's experience teaching a college class?

options.label: A
options.text: He was rejected by the professor.

options.label: B
options.text: He was unable to teach the class.

options.label: C
options.text: He successfully taught the class and fulfilled his dream.

options.label: D
options.text: He decided not to pursue teaching.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's message about rejection?

options.label: A
options.text: That it's always something to be feared.

options.label: B
options.text: That it's always something to be avoided.

options.label: C
options.text: That it can be an opportunity for growth and learning.

options.label: D
options.text: That it's never a good experience.

options.label: D
options.text: The object is stored in your short-term memory.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Hebbian principle in neuroscience?

options.label: A
options.text: Neurons that fire separately wire separately.

options.label: B
options.text: Neurons that fire together wire together.

options.label: C
options.text: Neurons that fire together never wire together.

options.label: D
options.text: Neurons that fire separately never wire together.

options.text: A hypothesis that explains how we can only imagine objects we have seen before.

options.label: B
options.text: A hypothesis that explains how we can imagine an infinite number of objects without seeing them.

options.label: C
options.text: A hypothesis that explains how the prefrontal cortex works.

options.label: D
options.text: A hypothesis that explains how myelination occurs.

options.label: B
options.text: The unconscious synchronization of different neuronal ensembles by the prefrontal cortex.

options.label: C
options.text: The synchronization of different neuronal ensembles by the posterior cortex.

options.label: D
options.text: The desynchronization of different neuronal ensembles by the prefrontal cortex.

options.text: They would arrive at the same time.

options.label: B
options.text: They would arrive out of sync.

options.label: C
options.text: They would not arrive at all.

options.label: B
options.text: Myelin is an insulator that speeds up electrical signals.

options.label: C
options.text: Myelin is a conductor that speeds up electrical signals.

options.label: D
options.text: Myelin is an insulator that slows down electrical signals.

options.label: A
options.text: The length of the neural fibers.

options.label: B
